Package edu.lehigh.cse216.team_m.backend

Class Database

java.lang.Object
edu.lehigh.cse216.team_m.backend.Database
public class Database extends Object
Class that holds and stores all DataRows

  • Field Details

    • mConnection

      private Connection mConnection
      The connection to the database. When there is no connection, it should be null. Otherwise, there is a valid open connection

    • mSelectAll

      private PreparedStatement mSelectAll
      A prepared statement for getting all data in the database

    • mSelectOne

      private PreparedStatement mSelectOne
      A prepared statement for getting one row from the database

    • mDeleteOne

      private PreparedStatement mDeleteOne
      A prepared statement for deleting a row from the database

    • mInsertOne

      private PreparedStatement mInsertOne
      A prepared statement for inserting into the database

    • mUpdateOne

      private PreparedStatement mUpdateOne
      A prepared statement for updating a single row in the database

    • mLikeOne

      private PreparedStatement mLikeOne
      A prepared statement for incrementing like on a single row in the database

    • mUnlikeOne

      private PreparedStatement mUnlikeOne
      A prepared statement for decrementing like on a single row in the database

    • mCreateTable

      private PreparedStatement mCreateTable
      A prepared statement for creating the table in our database

    • mDropTable

      private PreparedStatement mDropTable
      A prepared statement for dropping the table in our database

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      private Database()
      The Database constructor is private: we only create Database objects through the getDatabase() method.

  • Method Details

    • getDatabase

      static Database getDatabase(String ip, String port, String user, String pass)
      Get a fully-configured connection to the database
      Parameters:
      ip - The IP address of the database server
      port - The port on the database server to which connection requests should be sent
      user - The user ID to use when connecting
      pass - The password to use when connecting
      Returns:
      A Database object, or null if we cannot connect properly

    • getDatabase

      static Database getDatabase(String host, String port, String path, String user, String pass)
      Get a fully-configured connection to the database
      Parameters:
      host - The IP address or hostname of the database server
      port - The port on the database server to which connection requests should be sent
      path - The path to use, can be null
      user - The user ID to use when connecting
      pass - The password to use when connecting
      Returns:
      A Database object, or null if we cannot connect properly

    • getDatabase

      static Database getDatabase(String db_url, String port_default)
      Get a fully-configured connection to the database
      Parameters:
      db_url - The url to the database
      port_default - port to use if absent in db_url
      Returns:
      A Database object, or null if we cannot connect properly

    • disconnect

      boolean disconnect()
      Close the current connection to the database, if one exists. NB: The connection will always be null after this call, even if an error occurred during the closing operation.
      Returns:
      True if the connection was cleanly closed, false otherwise

    • insertRow

      int insertRow(String subject, String message)
      Insert a row into the database
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject for this new row
      message - The message body for this new row
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were inserted

    • selectAll

      ArrayList<DataRow> selectAll()
      Query the database for a list of all subjects, their IDs, content, and number of likes
      Returns:
      All rows, as an ArrayList

    • selectOne

      DataRow selectOne(int id)
      Get all data for a specific row, by ID
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the row being requested
      Returns:
      The data for the requested row, or null if the ID was invalid

    • deleteRow

      int deleteRow(int id)
      Delete a row by ID
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the row to delete
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were deleted. -1 indicates an error.

    • updateOne

      int updateOne(int id, String message)
      Update the message for a row in the database
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the row to update
      message - The new message contents
      Returns:
      The number of rows that were updated. -1 indicates an error.

    • likeOne

      int likeOne(int id)
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      int

    • unlikeOne

      int unlikeOne(int id)
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      int

    • createTable

      void createTable()
      Create tblData. If it already exists, this will print an error

    • dropTable

      void dropTable()
      Remove tblData from the database. If it does not exist, this will print an error.
